alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Orange (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 5:40PM EDT until July 05 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Alamance County in central North Carolina... Northern Orange County in central North Carolina... * Until 615 PM EDT. * At 539 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Yanceyville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Burlington, Hillsborough, Mebane, Haw River, Lake Cammack Park & Marina, Carr, Altamahaw-Ossipee, Glen Raven, Union Ridge and Altamahaw. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows as flying debris generated by damaging winds can be deadly.
